description: Nonprofits are using paper forms. The cost to digitize these forms to an HTML form in order to integrate it into their existing systems is difficult. Google Forms is great, yes, but it still requires some effort and knowledge without allowing integration with existing software applications. We have been working with ASU on two senior capstones around this problem that we can leverage as a head start.
title: Digitize Paper Forms

description: Having an online tax receipt will enable donors to drop off faster and increase our community support. Staff time will be utilized more efficiently and directed towards helping more clients.
title: Contactless Donation & Tax Receipt - Approval & Tracker

description:
Collecting, collating, managing, and evaluating information about our clients - including their household information, number and purpose of visits, and referrals provided - is a complicated and disjointed venture. For example, we use one program to track food bank households (Link2Feed) and an Access database created by a staff member to cross-track those clients as well as the clients coming to us for any other service in-house. This database is a vast improvement over the Excel spreadsheets we used prior, but has multiple functionality barriers. Among these barriers, only one user may access the database and enter data at one time, reports can be challenging to run, duplicate households are often found when auditing, and the database cannot be accessed outside of the network like an online database may be.

We are requesting assistance with creating a database that can:

Enable multi-user functionality concurrently
Track households and individuals
Allow us to include demographic information
Enable us to track office visits and quickly identify which program(s) a household or individual utilized
Facilitate real-time reporting that includes the ability to both schedule standard reports and create custom reports
Track donors and the value of volunteer hours
title: Data collection, data analysis, and data reporting

description: From pens, paper, and white boards to Excel spreadsheets and free volunteer scheduling programs we have tried to keep organized and reach our goals. In the end we feel frustrated, unorganized, scattered, and potentially ill-prepared for our lessons. This in turn could result in a student not being able to ride or worse yet not even being able to have a lesson that day; which breaks their heart and ours. In some cases this might even cause physical setbacks to their bodies.
title: Horse Volunteer Scheduling

description: We are interested in creating an app called "Teacher League". This app would introduce competition in the academic space while create a new way for the community to engage educators. Through Teacher League teachers submit videos to compete against each other in subject matter competitions. Anyone with the app can view the videos and vote on which teacher is the winner. The teacher with the most votes receives cash and prizes.
title: Teacher League

description: Like many nonprofits, Control Alt Delete struggles to illustrate how a donation supports their mission of helping women to escape domestic violence.  The anonymity that Control Alt Delete maintains is necessary, but hurts their ability to collect grant funding which shifts their focus to fundraising to support their cause.  If they are able to make donations more tangible to donors through their website, social media, and even augmented reality, the hope is that they can increase the people they can support through increased donations.
title: Tangible Donations

description:
Create an easy way for nonprofit staff to upload PDF, JPG, PPT documents (that can be from 2-10 pages or 2-10 JPG images of documents)
Provide a mechanism for the nonprofit staff to select different summarizations from the PDF documents and allow for easy copy/paste of this information into a website or WhatsApp
title: Document Summarization

description: A common problem exists with gathering and managing emails at volunteer or regular events - the normal process involves participants writing down their contact information by hand. This introduced problems with deciphering the contact info and proved to be ineffective. As a result, they were looking for a way to easily track and manage participant involvement in order to keep in contact with and retain their donors, recipients, and volunteers.
title: Volunteer Registration and Sign-up

description:
Allow donations to fund a specific project

1. New alternative to _post-hackathon_ statement of work (SOW) projects
2. Hackers can reach out to their network to increase donations
3. Sponsors can donate to complete projects
4. Mentors get some monetary reward
5. Donation can also be for maintenance/features after launch
6. Hackers can join and work on projects without a prize bounty
7. Opportunity Hack needs to earmark these funds only for prize payouts for these projects
title: ohack.dev: Cash Prize Bounty

description:
Publish to social media
Send Slack and emails to community
Ask for mentors and hackers
Close signups once max capacity is reached (5 hackers, 5 mentors)
title: ohack.dev: New Project Launch Announcement

description: The organization's donation mechanism does not deter people from donating as much as the challenge of raising visibility about this issue and encouraging people to donate to help address the issue. The issue is: 99% of all clients are financially abused. We help with one time assistance with rent/utility/move in payments allowing the women we help to remain housed during this transition to independence. These Survivors have needed financial and logistical help as they take control of their finances and futures. This is why we focused on considering gamification as a way to introduce people to an issue that people shun away from because domestic violence predominately attracts negative news. Introducing people to the issue doesn't necessarily lead to a donation unless there is something tangible like a feel-good story that they leave with.
title: Domestic Violence Awareness Game

description:
A mobile app or web app that first responders can use to secure needed resources like a cab ride, hotel stay, meals and moving companies.

With a quick method of addressing the needs of those fleeing domestic violence, a request for service can go out to all community partners and they can reply to commit to helping right then.
title: First Responder Connect

description:
Allow mentors/hackers to give feedback to hackers for hard/soft skills
Allow people to publish feedback publicly to add to their resume
Create milestones for certain feedback achievements
# of feedback given + received
Feedback score for programming language
Allow mentors/hackers to show how much effort they contributed
Commits
Standups
Video chats
Design documents
Display the nonprofits hackers/mentors supported
title: ohack.dev: Hackers and Mentors Build Clout

description: Although we've been creating value for nonprofits, we haven't created a way for people to be constantly involved in our mission.  We only have two events per-year, and we need something that helps us to scale to be more effective.  We're building ohack.dev to help us do that!
title: Create ohack.dev

description: We are looking for help to develop an online portal (career advisory) listing various career opportunities/avenues for KISS students and alumni. The aim of the portal is to mentor and guide the students while studying at KISS (and after they graduate) to ensure they are placed in both public and private services, in order to achieve a better representation of the indigenous communities.
title: Educational and Career Portal

description:
Allow for mentors and hackers to self-service and join projects
Search capability
Profile match based on skill (e.g. Python projects, etc.)
Match based on impact area (e.g. Students, Medical, Animals, etc.)
Favor projects that aren’t yet full (5 hackers, 5 mentors)
Solves the “I want to help, but there are no hackathons coming up” problem
Solves the “I work for ESPN and want to help a nonprofit” problem
title: ohack.dev: Help people find interesting projects

description:
Volunteers without a technical background can use ohack.dev to:
Source projects from nonprofits
Follow-up with nonprofits
Recruit sponsors to fund projects
Engage with previous hackers and mentors to get them to join
Social media engagement
Send newsletter to Women in Tech, Out in Tech, etc.
Slack engagement
title: ohack.dev: Enable Other Volunteer Opportunities

description:
Allow nonprofit/admin to mark project as completed
Create certificate
Publish social media acknowledgement
Trigger call for judges
Trigger scheduling for live demo once judges are found
Record live demo
Publish demo on social media
Trigger request to mentors for LinkedIn referrals
title: ohack.dev: Victory Lap on Completion

description:
Build a digital version of a guided journal that is currently printed and in PDF form

The digital version should be supported on mobile and personal computers

If the parent or student wants to share their journal, there should be an option to send the journal via email as a PDF
title: Digital Science Journal

description: Introduce a simple and free A/B testing system into the Shopify App store, current solutions range from $29 to $99 a month and for a small nonprofit organization, this is not sustainable
title: Free and Open-Source Shopify A/B Testing Solution

description: Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit, sed do eiusmod tempor incididunt ut labore et dolore magna aliqua.
title: Data Analysis

description: Some non-profits have "clients" that require demographics and treatment to be tracked easily. This usually requires some scheduling component as well as a historical record of visits with services provided, then reports follow. There are open-source EHR solutions on the internet, but none are simple enough for non-profits to use without dedicated training.
title: Simple EHR

description: We need to build the most amazing coloring book, sourced from kids’ sketches, that will make everyone want to buy one. These inspiring coloring books made by kids will also be provided to kids in need in our community, through Susie Q's Kids comfort bag program.
title: From Sketches to Smiles: A Coloring Book that Gives Back
